description: Dive into "Ooty's Picture-Perfect Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Ooty's Picture-Perfect Escapes

places.generalDescription: Karnataka Siri Horticulture Garden, nestled near Ooty's Thread Garden and Rose garden, is a breathtaking oasis maintained by Karnataka's Horticulture department. Surrounded by the Nilgiri hills, it offers a serene retreat into nature. The garden boasts 50,000 pots of diverse and stunning flowers and features various attractions such as the tea garden, topiary garden, flower beds, sunken garden, and more.

sources.snippet: Located near other attractions in Ooty like the Thread Garden and the Rose garden, this phenomenal place is maintained by Karnataka's Horticulture department. Surrounded by the Nilgiri hills, you will actually feel like you are sitting in the lap of nature when you relax here.The garden is exceptionally well maintained, and the main attraction here are the 50,000 pots with diverse and beautiful varieties of flowers. It is one of the best places to see in Ooty & sitting in this garden truly feels like being transported to a magical place.Grown at Fern hill, this location is famous for the tea garden, topiary garden, flower beds, sunken garden, and many many more.
sources.shortName: 50 Places to Visit in Ooty 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: Spread over 38 acres of land in Fern Hill, Karnataka Siri Horticulture Garden is the 2nd largest garden of Ooty. This garden welcomes you to its unique sections of flowers and vast lawns. Once here, you should visit its popular sections - Italian Garden, Rose Garden, Maze Garden, Sunken Garden, Topiary Garden and the Tea Garden.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to Visit in Ooty

sources.snippet: Among all the gardens that I visited in Ooty, this was my favorite. A paradise for professional photographers, the Karnataka Siri Horticulture Garden is a man-made wonderland that bewitches you with stunning natural beauty and intriguing architecture.
sources.shortName: 20 Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty, Things To Do & 2-Day Itinerary

places.name: Karnataka Siri Horticulture Garden

reviews.text:
This well-maintained garden is a feast for the eyes, with colorful flowerbeds, exotic plants, and lush lawns perfect for a relaxing stroll. The greenhouse garden is a standout, boasting stunning varieties in full bloom.
There is a maze and beautiful bridge in the middle of this garden.
Great for photography, picnics, and nature lovers, the garden offers a peaceful escape from the hustle of Ooty. Entry fees are nominal, and the clean pathways and scenic views make it worth every rupee.

Perfect for families, couples, children, and solo travelers! Don't miss this floral delight.

This is an absolute must visit! It's just simply beautiful. A massive park, unbelievably well maintained, pure bliss. We didn't feel like leaving there at all. They charge about Rs. 100 per person, but totally worth it. You can spend hours and hours here. It has a walking bridge too, with some ponds and a lot of different kinds of plants and flowers, of course. They even have an actual maze! Very well designed, well kept, please visit here ready to spend some quality time, ready to walk :)

This place is a must visit even if you are not a Horticulture or gardening enthusiast.
It offers breathtaking views of surrounding scenery and overall is very well organised.
Entry fee of INR 100 per adult is again a little steep for what's on offer but this location can enable you to spend a couple of hours without hassle.

The greenhouse is filled with various varieties of flowering plants and is a treat to visit. Personally, I liked it better than the one in Botanical gardens.

There are multiple washrooms available which is great since when we visited in June 2025, there was a nipping chill in the air with intermittent drizzling rain.

places.address: CM2M+9GV, Fern Hill, West Mere, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643004, India

places.generalDescription: The Government Botanical Garden, established in 1897, spans across 55 acres and was designed by the Marquis of Tweedale. The garden boasts well-maintained lawns, rare tree species such as the cork tree and the monkey puzzle tree, an Italian-style garden with a clear pool, and a diverse array of flowering plants. Visitors can also explore the fern house showcasing a wide variety of ferns and orchids.

sources.snippet: Botanical Garden is one of the best tourist attraction places which attract the tourist from all over the world. This garden was laid out in 1847 by the Marquis of Tweedale and is spread over 22 hectares ascending the slopes on the hill at an elevation of 2,400 meters above Main Sea Level. An explicit collection of flowering tress, beautiful shrubs, and rare colored lilies are seen.
sources.shortName: TOURIST PLACES IN OOTY / UDHAGAMANDALAM / QUEEN OF HILL STATIONS

sources.snippet: The Government Botanical Garden in Ooty, spread over 55 acres, is a mesmerizing tourist site that has been attracting visitors for years. Situated about 2400 ‚Äì 2500 mts above sea level, the botanical garden was established by Marquis of Tweedale in 1897 with William Graham McIvor as the architect.
sources.shortName: Ooty | Udhagamandalam | Hill stations in Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: The Botanical Garden of Ooty is home to endless green lawns, ponds, horticulture spaces and flower gardens. The 55 acre land is cultivated with more than 600 flowers, shrubs and plant species from different parts of the world. Nature walks, exhibitions, photography etc are highly covered here.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty (Udhagamandalam) (2025)

sources.snippet: Government Botanical Garden|#1 of 19 Places to Visit in Ooty. This is one of the best places to visit in Ooty for those who love trees and flowers. Even if you aren‚Äôt particularly interested in these, the aesthetic appeal of this attraction is sure to warm your heart.
sources.shortName: 19 Best Places to Visit in Ooty (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: Located 800 m from Charring Cross, the main market area of Ooty, the Government Botanical Garden is one of the main tourist attractions in Ooty. This 55-acre expansive garden is home to over 650 species of rare trees and plants worldwide.
sources.shortName: 20 Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty, Things To Do & 2-Day Itinerary

sources.snippet: Botanical Garden: Ooty‚Äôs beautiful botanical Garden is home to exotic plants that are planted in well-maintained lawns. Photography sessions here are often dotted with pretty bright colours of seasonal blooms.
sources.shortName: Ooty and Coonoor in the South offer great sight-seeing spots to beat the heat

sources.snippet: The stunning government Botanical Garden, Ooty Lake, mesmerizes Doddabetta Peak to one of the largest valleys in the world, Ketti Valley. The sights and sounds of Ooty will never fail to surprise you.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Places to Visit in Ooty | Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Spread over a huge area of 22 hectares and with more than 650 species of flowers and trees, the Botanical Garden is a horticulturist‚Äôs delight.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Ooty in 2024
Ooty Tourism | Tourist Places to Visit & Travel Guide to Ooty
90 Places To Visit In Ooty To Enjoy The Queen Of Hill Stations

places.name: Government Botanical Garden

reviews.text:
recently visited the Government Botanical Garden in Ooty, and it was truly a wonderful experience! Spread across about 22 hectares on the lower slopes of Doddabetta Peak, the garden is beautifully maintained and feels like a peaceful escape into nature.

The variety of plants is amazing - over 1,000 different species! I especially loved seeing rare trees like the cork tree, paper bark tree, and the fascinating monkey puzzle tree. One of the highlights for me was the 20-million-year-old fossilized tree trunk - it's incredible to see something that ancient up close.

The Italian Garden inside the park is also worth mentioning, with its terracotta figurines, fountains, and perfectly trimmed hedges giving it a charming, European feel. I also spent some time exploring the Fern House and Orchid Garden, where they have more than 30 types of ferns and some really rare orchids - simply beautiful!

The garden is open daily from 7:00 AM to 6:30 PM, and the entry fee is quite reasonable - ‚Çπ25 for adults and ‚Çπ15 for kids under 10. If you're carrying a camera, there's a small extra charge, but it's totally worth it because there's so much you'll want to capture.

If you can, try to visit during the annual Flower Show in May. I wasn't there during the show, but I've heard it's absolutely breathtaking with thousands of colorful displays!

Overall, whether you're a nature lover or just looking for a calm, scenic spot to relax, I highly recommend a visit to the Botanical Garden when you're in Ooty. It's definitely one of the highlights of my trip!

‚Ä¢ The botanical garden is such a beautiful sight to the eyes.
‚Ä¢ Various varieties of flowers & plantations all are beautifully maintained.
‚Ä¢ The grass landscape is such a beautiful place to sit peacefully & soak in the fresh air and nature's beauty.
‚Ä¢ The colourful, vibrant flowers of so many species are truly beautiful.
‚Ä¢ Definitely must visit place while in Ooty.

If I could give more than 5 stars, I truly would! Visiting this Garden was one of the most peaceful and refreshing experiences I've had-and I got to enjoy it with my brother and my best friend, which made it even more special.

From the moment we stepped in, it felt like we had entered a different world-so green, clean, and beautifully designed. The variety of plants and flowers was mind-blowing, and every corner had something unique to offer. We took so many photos, but honestly, no camera can do justice to how beautiful the place is in real life.

The garden is perfectly maintained-you can really see the care and hard work that goes into keeping it so neat and inviting. The lawns were trimmed, the flower beds vibrant, and not a single area looked ignored. Even the pathways were peaceful to walk on, and there were so many spots where we just sat, breathed in the fresh air, and took in the view.

The cool Ooty weather made the entire walk feel like a dream. We laughed, explored, and genuinely felt relaxed-no noise, no stress, just nature at its best. It's not just a tourist attraction, it's a place that touches your heart.

A big thank you to the management and staff for maintaining such a gem. This garden is more than just a place to visit-it's a must-have experience in Ooty. I'll never forget the time I spent here with my loved ones.

üíö Highly recommended to everyone-whether you're traveling solo, with friends, or family. It's a memory you'll carry forever.

places.address: CP96+HH2, Vannarapettai, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the picturesque hill station of Ooty, the Murugan Temple, Elk Hill is a serene and spiritual destination. The temple features a magnificent 40-foot golden statue of Lord Murugan, reminiscent of the one in Kuala Lumpur. Set amidst lush pine and eucalyptus forests, this tranquil spot offers visitors a peaceful retreat to seek blessings and capture stunning photographs.

sources.snippet: On your Ooty trip, seek blessings at the Elk Murugan Temple, located on top of the Elk Hill, which also promises an enthralling view of the hill station. Dedicated to Lord Murugan, this temple has a 40 feet high idol of the God. The statue is similar to the Idol of Lord Murugan in the Batu caves of Malaysia.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to Visit in Ooty

sources.snippet: There are no charges or permissions needed as it is a place of worship. In order to see the Lord Murugan statue and go to the temple, you will have to climb 108 steps barefoot which is quite fun with family and friends. It will leave you with loads of memories to cherish throughout your life.
sources.shortName: 50 Places to Visit in Ooty 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: The ancient Lord Murugan Temple, nestled on the slopes of Elk Hill, is home to one of the tallest (40 ft.) Murugan statues in the world. This gorgeous statue closely resembles the 140 ft. golden statue of Lord Muruga situated at the entrance of Malaysia‚Äôs Batu Caves.
sources.shortName: 20 Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty, Things To Do & 2-Day Itinerary

sources.snippet: Elk Hill Lord Murugan Temple|#7 of 19 Places to Visit in Ooty. Considered as one of the most beautiful hills in Ooty, Elk Hill is home to the famous Elk Hill Lord Murugan Temple. The temple is dedicated to Lord Murugan, well known as the warrior god.
sources.shortName: 19 Best Places to Visit in Ooty (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: The beautiful Elk Hill is home to the temple which is among the most revered tourist attraction in Ooty. It is dedicated to Lord Murugan, the famous warrior god. The temple's primary attraction is a statue of Lord Murugan that is 40 feet tall.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Ooty in 2024

places.name: Murugan Temple, Elk Hill

reviews.text: A vibrant and scenic Murugan temple located atop a hill-truly a feast for the eyes and soul. The natural beauty and pleasant climate around the temple make every visit special. I've been coming here since 2016, and it never fails to uplift. However, at some points, the route to this temple can be a bit challenging, so plan accordingly. A must-visit for both spiritual seekers and nature lovers.

Situated at a height far from Ooty lake, the statue of Lord murugan is big & beautiful. You need to climb some stairs. Unfortunately when we visited, the temple was closed as arrangements were going on for some Pooja.

Although overall worth a visit, it can be skipped if you have limited time as roads leading to the temple are narrow and often blocked by traffic.

I feel before you go to any place. You have to take permission of the local God and then start the trip. Likewise, we started our Ooty  trip by visiting this temple first.

Very, very nice temple, calm environment. Nice view at the top.
Not much of stairs to climb not that difficult

places.generalDescription: The Government Rose Garden, also known as the Centenary Rose Park, is a sprawling paradise for flower enthusiasts located in Ooty, India. Established in 1995 and spanning over 4 hectares, this garden showcases thousands of varieties of roses including hybrid tea roses, floribunda roses, and miniature roses. The beautifully landscaped terraced slopes and pathways make it a prominent tourist attraction in Ooty.

sources.snippet: Rose GardenAddress: Bombay Kist, Ooty, Tamil Nadu, 643001, IndiaDistance from Ooty: 2.8 KMContact:  0423 244 4070Recommended Timings: 8:30 am ‚Äì 6:00 pmEntrance Fee: ‚Çπ20 per person ‚Çπ30 for Still Camera ‚Çπ75 for Video Camera. The World Federation of Rose Societies has recognized this rose garden and presented ‚ÄúThe Garden of Excellence Award‚Äù for South Asia, All this credit goes to the management is an Elite club of 35 rose gardens.
sources.shortName: 18 BEST Places to Visit in Ooty for 2 Days | Ooty Nearest Airport

sources.snippet: Your trip to Ooty would be incomplete if you do not include the largest rose garden in the country in your sightseeing plans. Located on the beautiful slopes of Elk Hill, the Government Rose Garden is a place that will give you the best of pictures and most amazing memories. Home to almost 20000 varieties of roses, it has been one of the most popular tourist spots in the state since 1995.
sources.shortName: 19 Best Places to Visit in Ooty (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: The Ooty Rose Garden brings a vast collection of different types of roses to the very center of Ooty. This mesmerizing garden is also known by several other names such as the Nootrandy Roja Poonga, the Jayalalithaa Rose Garden, and the Centenary Rose Park. The Ooty Rose Garden is a big draw for nature lovers from all over the hill station.
sources.shortName: 6 Incredible Places to Visit in Ooty (Udhagamandalam or Ootacamund) (2024)

sources.snippet: Maintained by the Government of Tamil Nadu, this garden is spread across 4 hectares of land and proudly presents more than 20 thousand varieties of roses. A well maintained garden, it also boasts of winning the Garden of Excellence Award for South Asia from the World Federation of Rose Societies.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to Visit in Ooty

sources.snippet: Rose Park is situated in the heart of Ooty town and it is located less than a km from Charring Cross at Vijayanagaram, the rose garden is laid on 10 acres of land. This garden has been beautifully laid out in terraces with rose tunnels, pergolas and bowers with rose creepers.
sources.shortName: TOURIST PLACES IN OOTY / UDHAGAMANDALAM / QUEEN OF HILL STATIONS

sources.snippet: End your two-day itinerary with a visit to the Government Rose Garden. Spread over 4 hectares, this garden is home to thousands of varieties of roses. Admire the vibrant colors and intoxicating fragrance of the roses as you explore the well-manicured lawns and flower beds.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in ooty in two days, Top tourist places

sources.snippet: The Largest rose gardens in India, the Government Rose Gardens lie on the slopes of the Elk Hill at an elevation of 2200 meters above sea level. It also has one of the largest collections of roses with more than 20,000 different varieties.
sources.shortName: 18 Places To Visit In Ooty

sources.snippet: On the lovely slope of Elk Hills is a lovelier garden that blooms with roses. It is called by many names, some call it the Nootranju Roja Poonga, some call it Jayalalithaa Rose Garden. While others call it the Centenary Rose Park.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty (Udhagamandalam) (2025)

sources.snippet: Botanical Garden, Rose Garden, Ketti Valley View, Doddabetta Peak, Nilgiri Mountain Railway, Avalanche Lake, Upper Bhavani Lake, Ooty Lake, Mukurthi National Park
sources.shortName: 20 Best Places to Visit in Ooty | Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Rose garden lies in the heart and soul of Ooty.The construction stays to be magnificent and there are small tunnels made wherein the roses are planted.
sources.shortName: 43 Best Places to visit in Ooty | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: One of the most Instagram-worthy places in Ooty, the Rose Garden has a cinematic ambiance with rose creepers twining over tunnels and bowers.
sources.shortName: 20 Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty, Things To Do & 2-Day Itinerary
Ooty Tourism | Tourist Places to Visit & Travel Guide to Ooty

places.name: Government Rose Garden

reviews.text: We visited this place in May 2nd week.  There was a flower show going on.  100rs entry ticket here is worthy.  They had an aquatic theme this year. There were lot of interesting stuffs here like dolphins, mermaid, fishes, tortoise,  snails made of roses. We truly enjoyed our time here.  We took some family photo by a photographer. Only problem is you need to walk a long distance. This is far far better than govt botanical garden.

We visited the Government Rose Garden during our trip to Ooty in June. The garden is beautifully maintained and quite expansive, offering a peaceful environment for a stroll. However, since it was not peak blooming season, there were only a few roses in full bloom during our visit.

The entry fees are Rs. 75 for adults and Rs. 40 for children, with additional charges of Rs. 50 for carrying a camera and Rs. 100 for a video camera, which felt a bit excessive. Paid parking is available across the road but is limited.

Overall, it was a decent experience, worth a visit if you're in Ooty, especially during peak blooming season.

The Government Rose Garden in Ooty is a captivating destination for nature enthusiasts and flower lovers alike. Established in 1995 to commemorate the Centenary Flower Show, this expansive garden spans approximately 10 acres on the slopes of Elk Hill, providing visitors with breathtaking views and a serene atmosphere.

Home to over 20,000 varieties of roses, the garden boasts an impressive collection that includes Hybrid Tea Roses, Miniature Roses, Floribunda, Ramblers, and unique colors like green and black roses. These blooms are meticulously arranged across five terraced levels, featuring rose tunnels, pergolas, and bowers adorned with creepers, creating a visual feast for visitors.

Practical Information
‚Ä¢	Timings: Open daily from 7:30 AM to 6:30 PM.
‚Ä¢	Entry Fee: ‚Çπ75 for adults and ‚Çπ40 for children below 10 years. Additional charges apply for cameras: ‚Çπ50 for still cameras and ‚Çπ100 for video cameras.
‚Ä¢	Best Time to Visit: The optimal period to experience the roses in full bloom is from March to June, when the flowers are at their most vibrant.

The Government Rose Garden stands as a testament to Ooty's rich horticultural heritage. Its vast collection of roses, thoughtful layout, and serene ambiance make it a must-visit destination for those seeking natural beauty and tranquility in the heart of the Nilgiris.

places.address: Rose garden, Davisdale, Bombay Castle, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

places.generalDescription: C.S.I St. Stephen's Church, established in 1830, is a historic church known for its stunning stained-glass windows and a captivating painting of the Last Supper. The church is a part of various sightseeing tours in Ooty, including the evocative 'Through a Slice of History' tour and the tranquil 'Into the Countryside' excursion.

sources.snippet: One of the oldest churches in the Nilgiris built during the British era, St Stephan‚Äôs Church, Ooty is one of the best Ooty visiting places to see colonial architecture. There is a remarkable painting depicting the Last Supper. Other than that, stained glass windows depict other scenes such as Mother Mary holding baby Jesus in her arms.
sources.shortName: 19 Best Places to Visit in Ooty (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: St Stephen‚Äôs Church Address: Club Road, Ooty, Tamil Nadu, 643001, IndiaDistance from Ooty: 1.3 KMContact: 0423 2442 121Recommended Timings: 10:00 am ‚Äì 1:00 pm ‚Äì 3:00 pm ‚Äì 5:00 pmEntrance Fee: N/A. St Stephen‚Äôs Church Ooty is an old church that was built by the British in the 19th century and it is an architectural marvel in Ooty.
sources.shortName: 18 BEST Places to Visit in Ooty for 2 Days | Ooty Nearest Airport

sources.snippet: A church of great antiquity and impeccable architectural beauty, St Stephen‚Äôs Church is a remarkable landmark of Ooty that is a window into the long history of the queen of hill stations. The church, embellished with beautiful stained-glass windows and antique features, is a jewel in the crown of the queen of Nilgiris.
sources.shortName: Ooty | Udhagamandalam | Hill stations in Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: The St. Stephen's Church in Ooty is indeed a marvellous and breathtaking architectural marvel located on the road to Mysore in Ooty. It is one of the earliest churches that you will find in the Nilgiris district. The structure dates back to the 19th century and was built by the British government.
sources.shortName: 43 Best Places to visit in Ooty | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Dating back to the 19th century, St. Stephen Church is a place to visit in Ooty for its architectural beauty and religious importance. Although comparatively simpler, this church has beautiful interiors. The painted glass windows along with the painting of Last Supper is especially captivating.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to Visit in Ooty

sources.snippet: This 19th-century, Gothic-styled, colossal church is one of the most famous churches in Ooty. The foundation of St. Stephen‚Äôs Church was laid in 1829 and opened to the public in 1831. Surrounded by pine and eucalyptus trees, the tranquil ambiance of the church is ideal for self-reflection.
sources.shortName: 20 Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty, Things To Do & 2-Day Itinerary

sources.snippet: Back in 1829, the then Governor of Ooty declared to build a church exclusively for the Britishers there. It was constructed by J.J Underwood and cost about Rs. 24,000/- then. It is known for its architectural beauty and holds importance as a coveted top tourist spot in Ooty.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty (Udhagamandalam) (2025)

sources.snippet: Built in the early 19th century, St. Stephens Church is one of the oldest churches in the Nilgiris District in Tamil Nadu. The foundation of the church was laid in 1829 and shares the date with the birthday of King George IV.
sources.shortName: 18 Places To Visit In Ooty
20 Best Places to Visit in Ooty | Tamil Nadu
18 Places to Visit in Ooty

places.name: C.S.I St. Stephen's Church

reviews.text:
Small Gothic Church one of the first colonial structions built in the 1820 s on the site of a Toda Temple. Timber for the roof was hauled here by elephant from Tipu Sultan's Palace in Srirangapatnam (Mysore). Nice stained glass windows and an interesting graveyard at the back, but not that outstanding.
This is one of the bigger heritage Church in Ooty with beautiful architecture and the compound beautifully decorated with a garden having wide variety of flowers. Also the beautiful view of the hills in the distance was mesmerizing. It was definitely worth the walk.¬†We enjoyed clicking pictures in the Church compound and had a great time.
It has a nice peaceful vibe. If you are interested in places of worship, you could surely visit this church.

A beautiful church in the centre of Ooty built in 1830 and now used as a practicing church of the Church of South India. There are some attractive stained glass windows. There is a big area around with gardens. The church and compounds are well preserved and maintained. No entry tickets are required. Parking is available in the compound.

Loved the way it is situated and maintained by the managing team.
Parking is an issue inside the premises. They should make a separate parking lot at neighbourhoods but not in premises.
I was fortunate enough to witness the Sunday service there. Beautiful hymns and spirituality. One must visit the place and sit for a white to have the feel of the place.
I was returning from Ramkrishna math and got dropped at church. Thanks to God

places.address: CP72+VW7, Road, near Collectors office, Club, Upper Bazar, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

places.generalDescription: Tamilnadu Tourism Boat House in Ooty is a popular destination for tourists, offering activities such as paddleboating and rowing on a scenic lake. The area also features the Doddabetta Peak, Government Rose Garden, Nilgiri Mountain Railway Line, and other attractions. Built by John Sullivan, the boat house provides a serene environment surrounded by eucalyptus trees. Nearby, visitors can explore the Mini Garden with its amusement park and toy train for children.

sources.snippet: **From just behind the central Bus Stand (also near the Railway station) the famous Ooty Lake stretches, in an irregular 'L' shape, for about 2.75 kms in length and varying distances in width(100m ‚Äì 140m). For the curious, this lake was artificially formed by John Sullivan, the founder of Ooty, in 1823-25 by damming the mountain streams flowing down Ooty valley.
sources.shortName: TOURIST PLACES IN OOTY / UDHAGAMANDALAM / QUEEN OF HILL STATIONS

sources.snippet: Enjoy a day at the Ooty Boathouse, where you can lie back and people watch. The sight of the Ooty lake is like paradise with the hustle and bustle of surrounding areas adding a natural cacophony to its feel. You can enjoy boating competitions if you visit here in May, or go motor boating with your partner or friend.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty (Udhagamandalam) (2025)

places.name: Tamilnadu Tourism Boat House, Ooty

reviews.text:
I rarely post 5 star reviews. We had a terrific time with the boating, my child loved it.

The whole lake is so beautiful and scenic. They have an indoor play area with a soft playground, dashing cars, train, car and bikes for children. Pricing is very affordable.

They have a decent variety of food and snacks. A big parking area in the front. Clean and well maintained restrooms.

This place is usually crowded so plan accordingly.

I visited the Tamilnadu Tourism Boat House in Ooty with my friends. It was very crowded, but we were lucky to find a bench right beside the lake. Sitting there felt really peaceful. The cool breeze and fresh air made the moment special. Watching people enjoy boating and looking at the water was very relaxing. It was a great place to hang out and feel close to nature. I really enjoyed the time with my friends there.

When you come to Ooty, your primary attraction is boating in the lake.  You purchase a ticket of ‚Çπ25 for entry in to the boating and shopping area.
Then if you want to go for boating, you pay again as per the choice of boating experience you want to have.
When we visited, it was drizzling and we preferred motor boat. The charges were ‚Çπ825 for a 20 minutes ride allowing upto six people.
We were two persons and found another couple willing to share the boat and the cost.
Enjoyed.

places.address: N Lake Rd, West Mere, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

places.generalDescription: Ooty Lake is a must-visit attraction in Ooty, located amidst the picturesque Nilgiris district. This 65-acre artificial lake was established during the British Raj and offers various boating experiences against a stunning backdrop of mountains and eucalyptus trees. Visitors can also explore the nearby thread garden, take a shikara ride, or indulge in adventure camping at the surrounding tea gardens.

sources.snippet: Ooty was originally a tribal land occupied by the Todas along with other tribes. The Nilgiri territory came into possession of East India Company as part of the ceded lands, held by Tipu Sultan in 1799. In 1818, Wish and Kindersley, Assistant and Second Assistant to Collector of Coimbatore visited this spot and submitted their experience report to the Collector of Coimbatore John Sullivan.
sources.shortName: Ooty Tourism | Tourist Places to Visit & Travel Guide to Ooty

sources.snippet: Located opposite the Ooty Lake and 1.5 km away from the railway station, Ooty Thread Garden is another unique tourist attraction in the town. Brainchild of a former professor Mr. Antony Joseph, it is a garden made of artificial flowers. All the flowers and the plants are made out of thread, using the four dimensional hand-wound embroidery.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to Visit in Ooty

sources.snippet: This 2.5 km long lake was constructed in 1825 and winds its way through the stunning Nilgiri Mountains, making it a popular location for picnics in Ooty. Ooty Lake, nestled amongst tall pines, is a great place for a picnic and a relaxing boat ride. It is among the most breathtaking places to see in Ooty.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Ooty in 2024

sources.snippet: If you are looking for places to visit in Ooty in 1 day, you must include Ooty Lake in your itinerary. Formed during the British Raj in 1824, this artificial lake is spread across 65 acres. Surrounded by lush mountains, the landscape is magical, especially with the mist lingering around the green cover.
sources.shortName: 19 Best Places to Visit in Ooty (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: The lake is located just 2 kilometers from the main city of Ooty in the green mountain range of the Nilgiris. This stunning and crystal clear lake is spread over an area of over 60 acres. The foundation of Ooty Lake was laid down by the erstwhile Collector of Coimbatore, John Sullivan, in 1824.

sources.snippet: This is the prime attraction of Ooty and is an artificial lake which was constructed by John Sullivan in the year 1824. This was made by making dams run by the waters from the river which flowed down to the valley region. The main motive was to help fishermen by making fishing ferries out ...

sources.snippet: A very famous attraction in Ooty, the Ooty Lake is home to beautiful boathouses, fishing corners, cycling tracks and street shops. People come here to enjoy the full nature and cultural fiesta of this region. A summer festival in season draws even more crowd.

sources.snippet: If you are fond of gaiety lake rides, then Ooty has got your back. Home to some wonderful and glistening lakes, Ooty is a hub for all the water lovers. The most famous among them, being the Ooty Lake, it is an artificial lake in the shape of an irregular ‚ÄòL‚Äô.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Ooty

sources.snippet: Boating in Ooty Lake or Pykara Dam: Watch the sun turn amber as it sets when you go boating in Ooty Lake. Another fabulous option is to head to the Pykara Dam for some boating fun. You can go for the traditional rowing or you can try speed boating.

sources.snippet: Covering an area of around 65 acres, the Ooty Lake is a manmade lake formed in 1824 under the British. It features a boathouse which offers boating facilities to the visitors and is famous for hosting boat races during the summer month of May.

sources.snippet: Surrounded by eucalyptus trees and lush greenery, this artificial lake offers boating facilities. Enjoy a peaceful boat ride and soak in the serenity of the surroundings. The lake also has a charming garden and a mini-train ride for children.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in ooty in two days, Top tourist places

sources.snippet: The picturesque Ooty Lake, also known as the Ooty boat house, is a much sought-after tourist attraction located in the midst of serene greenery. The Ooty Lake is an artificially constructed lake, built by John Sullivan in 1824.

sources.snippet: Ooty Lake is like that perfect mirror you always wanted ‚Äì except it‚Äôs vast and surrounded by eucalyptus trees. This artificial lake, spread over 65 acres, offers many photo opportunities.

sources.snippet: A man-made lake surrounded by eucalyptus trees, Ooty Lake is a popular spot for boating. Visitors can also enjoy cycling around the lake or simply relaxing by the serene waters.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Ooty Tamil Nadu Ootacamund

places.name: Ooty Lake

reviews.text:
Okay, continuing my Ooty adventures, after taking in the views and the charming train ride, a classic Ooty experience I indulged in was Pedal Boating at Ooty Lake. And honestly, it was such a delightful and relaxing way to spend an afternoon!

Ooty Lake itself is a pretty prominent feature of the town, and as soon as I got there, I could see all these colorful pedal boats dotting the water. The atmosphere around the lake is quite lively, with vendors and other tourists, but once you're out on the water, it feels surprisingly peaceful.

Renting a pedal boat was straightforward and pretty affordable. My friend and I hopped into one, and it was quite comfortable. The pedal mechanism was easy to use, so even if you're not super athletic, you can still leisurely cruise around the lake without much effort.

Being out on the water gave me a completely different perspective of Ooty. The surrounding hills, the tall trees, and the small boats all around created a very picturesque scene. We just pedaled gently, chatted, and enjoyed the cool breeze. It was a lovely break from walking and sightseeing, a chance to just sit back (or pedal gently!) and enjoy the natural beauty.

I also saw people having little races, families laughing, and couples enjoying quiet moments ‚Äì it's an activity that truly suits everyone. You get to feel the freshness of the air, see the reflection of the trees on the water, and just appreciate the simple joy of being outdoors.

Overall, pedal boating at Ooty Lake is a quintessential Ooty experience for a reason. It's fun, relaxing, and offers some great views. If you're in Ooty, definitely take an hour or so to get out on the water. It's a wonderfully refreshing activity that adds a nice, easygoing charm to your trip!
Nice place to spend some time. Didn't get to experience the boat ride because of rain but still worth it because of the cafes and various shops. Also, there are some fun rides for kids as well

Ooty Lake is such a lovely place to spend a few peaceful hours. The lake is surrounded by tall eucalyptus trees and scenic hills, creating a calm and refreshing atmosphere. Boating here is a must-whether you choose a pedal boat or a rowboat, it's a wonderful way to take in the views and enjoy the cool breeze.

There's also a small park area, food stalls, and shops nearby where you can pick up snacks or souvenirs. The place is well-maintained, and the facilities are quite good. It's perfect for families, couples, or anyone who wants to unwind and soak up the natural beauty of Ooty.

places.generalDescription: Wax Planet is a popular wax museum located inside the Ice Thunder campus in Ooty. It features lifelike wax models of famous personalities such as Gandhi Ji, Obama, Johnny Depp, and even offers the opportunity to play KBC with Amitabh Bachchan and meet Iron Man. Visitors praise the realistic detailing of the models, particularly noting the attention-grabbing eyes and impressive skin detailing.

sources.snippet: Admire and click photos with the life-like wax statues of famous personalities at the Wax Studio (Wax Planet), Ooty. Here you will find statues of leaders like Mahatma Gandhi, Mother Teresa, Gopal Krishna Gokhle, Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam and film stars like Amitabh Bachchan, Rajinikanth, Vin Diesel, Bruce Lee, Michael Jackson, etc. It is located just a few minutes away from Ooty railway station and remains open until 8 PM every day of the week.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to Visit in Ooty

places.name: Wax Planet

reviews.text:
I only visited the Wax Planet, Ooty, in the evening instead of the whole amusement park Thunder World which might be more cost effective I think. The carpark was located less than 100m away. I bought my Wax Planet entry ticket at the Main Kiosks which wasn't crowded and put on my wrist tag before entering the designated area.

This wasn't a big museum as compared with Madame Tussauds in Bangkok, Delhi, Hong Kong and Singapore but it did house many life-sized wax figurines which were excellently and distinctly made. Everything smelled new. Figurines were appealing and there were good lightings and props to go with.

Highly appreciated the greetings of the figurine of Mother Theresa here. It was so realistic. Personally, others were generally good like the figurines of Mahatma Ghandi, Obama, Donald Trump, Modi and Putin and actors Bruce Willis and Hugh Jackman. This museum was small scale unlike the one in Delhi which the wax figurines were widely spaced out. So I spent about a good 25-minutes here. There was a horse riding service along the road outside for those who were keen to go for it. Family with kids generally would go for the entire coverage of Thunder World and Wax Planet.

Good to drop by if one is in Ooty.

Good for children but it costs high 650 for adults and 550 for children.... U can't see wax museum alone as they charge for both thunder world and wax museum together.... I would recommend for wax museum which I felt worth but not thunder world...

The place is amazing! Every statue looks so realistic. Even the background for each statue looks authentic. It's like stealing a memory from every famous person and making ourselves a part of it. Definitely must visit when in Ooty.

places.address: Thunder World, N Lake Rd, Mani Vihar, Kathadimattam, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

places.generalDescription: Doddabetta Peak, standing at 8,650 feet, offers road access and features a forest preserve at its summit along with a telescope observatory. The property near the peak consists of just 8 well-maintained rooms surrounded by beautiful flora and fauna. Guests can explore nearby tourist attractions such as the tea and chocolate museum and enjoy walks in the adjacent tea gardens. The caretakers are highly praised for their exceptional service, offering assistance with queries, local transport, and sightseeing arrangements.

sources.snippet: Doddabetta Peak Address: Ooty Kotagiri Road, Ooty, The Nilgiris, Tamil Nadu, 643002, IndiaDistance from Ooty: 9 KMContact:  0423 2538 3333Recommended Timings: 7:00 am ‚Äì 6:00 pmEntrance Fee:. sources.snippet: To enjoy a panoramic view of the Nilgiris hills, take a trip to Doddabetta Peak. In fact, include this in your itinerary if you are looking for places to visit in Ooty Doddabetta, the highest peak of the Nilgiris, which is located 10 km from Ooty. Surrounded by dense forests consisting of beautiful pine trees and other flora, the region is spectacularly green.
sources.shortName: 19 Best Places to Visit in Ooty (2024): Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: Doddabetta, meaning Big Peak, is the highest peak of the Nilgiri Hills. Located just ten kilometers away from Ooty, it stands at a massive height of 8650 feet above sea level (or 2623 meters). This majestic peak is indeed a treat to the eyes, and not only is it one of the most popular tourist spots in Ooty, but also a popular trekking route.
sources.shortName: 6 Incredible Places to Visit in Ooty (Udhagamandalam or Ootacamund) (2024)

sources.snippet: **Doddabetta Peak :      The Doddabetta Peak stands at an altitude of 2,623 meters. It is the highest point in the district, making it possibly the best vantage point around Ooty. It is merely 10kms from Ooty so you can simply grab your camera and head straight to the peak, and click amazing pictures of the valley below.
sources.shortName: TOURIST PLACES IN OOTY / UDHAGAMANDALAM / QUEEN OF HILL STATIONS

sources.snippet: Dodabetta, literally translating to mean - Big Peak, is located approximately 10 km away from Ooty. It towers to a staggering height of 8650 feet or 2,623 meters above the sea level and is the highest peak in the Nilgiri Hills. A treat to the eyes, this picturesque land is indeed a great sightseeing place.

sources.snippet: This is the highest peak in the Nilgiri region and is about 10 kilometres from the city of Udhagamandalam or Ooty. A spectacular trail with an unparalleled vantage point of Ooty at the end of it makes Doddabetta a rewarding trekking experience and the perfect spot for a fun-filled day out with family as well.

sources.snippet: Doddabetta Peak, with a height of 8,606 feet, is the highest peak in South India and can be found just 10 kilometres from Ooty. Doddabetta Peak, which is surrounded by forests, provides a breathtaking panorama of the Nilgiris. It is among the most scenic places to visit in Ooty.

sources.snippet: A visit to Doddabetta Peak was the reason I went to Ooty in the first place. I had heard a lot about the picturesque Nilgiris and the amazing views this place has to offer. The place stands at a height of around 8,650 feet and makes it the highest peaks in south India.

places.name: Doddabetta Peak

reviews.text:
We visited during June, when it was a bit rainy. Added to it was a thick fog due to which we were not treated to the panoramic views.
But what we lost in the views was negated by a serene feeling of being amidst the clouds with an eerie chill in the air. For mountain lovers, a must visit.

There are stalls for snacks and beverages. Entry fee of INR 10 for adults.

There may be a traffic near view point on week end we have to wait near 15 mins, but after that we can see the full beauty of the ooty view. We can cover almost full of the area from here. Stunning view is there try to be visit on sunny day otherwise mist may hide the view. Entry fee will be collected at the entry for vehicle and we have to pay 20 rs per head we can pay through UPI also. Many shops available there we can purchase small things. Restroom available here.

Very good View from the top. Well placed arrows and garden areas, specific to differently ranges and views of the city. Plenty of parking available with lot pf shops to buy souvenirs, restaurant and tea points. Many photos options were available. Advice to go early in the morning for clear skies. Do keep an eye on Monkeys.

places.generalDescription: Wenlock Downs 9th Mile Shooting Point in Ooty is a hidden gem that offers stunning panoramic views. The picturesque meadows, surrounded by distant mountains, resemble the beauty of Gulmarg. Visitors can engage in activities like trekking or enjoy a leisurely picnic. The site provides an opportunity for drone flying and capturing the landscape's beauty. It's an ideal spot to witness mesmerizing sunsets amidst lush tea gardens and misty clouds covering the hills.

sources.shortName: 20 Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty, Things To Do & 2-Day Itinerary

places.name: View point

reviews.text:
Nice place

but When i Go There There is No Place to Get Inside...Main Gate was locked

its Just a Normal Road...so U can Click Pictures from The Road only...as Per My Experience

In Ooty & Coonoor U will Get So Many Places like that when u Ride with Your Own Vehicle

but So Bad
For Travellers Two Wheelers rental Are Banned in Ooty From Last 5 Years

if Any Bike Dealer giving on Rental Bike Dont Take....its Illigal.....Otherwise u will be Trapped in The Game
Amazing view point on the way to Ooty. Located at one of the curves on the road, the place is full of tea estates on one side and a small hill on the other side. So beautiful to watch

Witnessing a breathtaking sunset that painted the sky with hues of wonder. üåÖ An unforgettable experience for photography enthusiasts! üì∏üåø

places.generalDescription: Nestled near the picturesque Ooty Botanical Gardens, the Government Museum is a delightful gem that invites visitors to explore the vibrant cultural and natural heritage of the Nilgiri region. Established in 1989, this charming museum serves as a window into local history, showcasing an impressive array of tribal artifacts, archaeological treasures, and exhibits dedicated to the area's unique flora and fauna.

sources.snippet: On the Ooty-Mysore Road, Government Museum Ooty, is another place to visit for a glimpse into the land‚Äôs rich history. This museum was established in 1851. It showcases a wide array of sculptures, paintings, artefacts belonging to the tribes of Ooty.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to Visit in Ooty

sources.snippet: The Stone House was the residence of John Sullivan, the founder of the British settlement of Ootacamund or Ooty. Now a government museum, this magnificent two-storey stone mansion was the first bungalow that was built in the hill station.
sources.shortName: 20 Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty, Things To Do & 2-Day Itinerary

places.name: Government Museum

reviews.text: Beautiful place to visit if you art enthusiast. Most important thing I like about the government museum is the building which is completely made of stone. Building architecture is excellent and one does not stop looking at it again and again. Construction of such type of building is impossible in modern world. The building was constructed in early part of 19th century possibly in 1823. The museum depicts tribal culture particularly those of the todas. Other artifacts depicting local culture and history are also kept in the museum. Must visit site.

Visited the Stone House Museum in Ooty and had a lovely time! It's a compact but well-curated place showcasing tribal culture, colonial history, and Nilgiri wildlife. Highlights include Toda artifacts, old photographs, and preserved animal specimens-perfect for anyone curious about Ooty's roots.

The museum is kid-friendly, and there's plenty to see for both adults and children. However, be aware there's a staircase to the upper floor, so not fully accessible for elderly visitors or those with mobility challenges. There's a small entry fee, and photography requires an extra ticket. Also, no restroom facilities inside, so please plan ahead.

A charming, quick stop to get a glimpse into Ooty's history and heritage!

Visited today good knowledge of history and u can see the physical preserved items which tribe used.
Must visit once if you are in ooty.
Ticket Price is 10rs

places.address: Kotagiri Rd, near Arts College, Stone House, Stone House Area, Kil Kodappamund, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

places.generalDescription: The Ooty Golf Course is a serene 21-hole golf course located on the rolling Wenlock Downs, around 7000ft above sea level. Managed by the Gymkhana Club in Ooty, it spans across 193.56 acres and offers picturesque views of Ooty from the highest point in the Nilgiri Hills. Surrounded by reserved forest area, this prominent golf destination provides a peaceful retreat for both members and tourists alike.

sources.snippet: Doddabetta Peak should not be missed on your travel itinerary if you are in Ooty. It is one of the highest peaks of the Nilgiris. If you are a nature lover, then this sight will definitely delight your heart.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Places to Visit in Ooty | Tamil Nadu

places.name: Ooty Golf Course

reviews.text: Nice place to visit better to go in the evening or in the early morning you will be having pleasant moment but be cautious since leopard and tiger may come there be careful while your going to that place

Stayed here with friends on my trip to Ooty. Rooms were quite spacious and well facilitated. But the property seemed old and could do with a little more maintenance.

We weren't dressed appropriately to enter the club but otherwise it's a nice premises. A little pricey though.

Great Caddies. Amazing location. Tiring slopes. Feel sorry that we were the only golfers there. And yet, despite our offering to pay green fees for a friend who had driven us around, the management were adamant that non golfers couldn't walk around. So just played 9 holes and didn't return. Quite a neglected course.. but very picturesque. A colonial mindset perhaps. How do you encourage people to play golf if you shoo them away. We had a few references from friends... but yet paid the full visitors fees as the front desk said they'd have to hear from them directly.. (that's fair enough) but the attitude was not right in my opinion. I've chaired a club for over 6 years and have been on committees for 20 years, am a member in a IGF course...and have attended R&A conventions....with this attitude, golf in Ooty could die out.

places.address: CM99+W63, Golf Course Road, Fingerpost, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643006, India

places.generalDescription: Ketti Valley View Point is a scenic spot located in the Ketti valley, in the Nilgiris district of Tamil Nadu, India. The view from the viewpoint overlooks rolling hills, wildflowers, and rustic lodges nearby.

sources.snippet: Fringed by the rolling hills of the Nilgiris and spanning the horizon like an endless green ocean is Ketty Valley. A picturesque view of over 14 quaint hamlets awaits travellers as they head to Ketty Valley, also known as the Switzerland of South India.
sources.shortName: Ooty | Udhagamandalam | Hill stations in Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Botanical Garden, Rose Garden, Ketti Valley View, Doddabetta Peak, Nilgiri Mountain Railway, Avalanche Lake, Upper Bhavani Lake, Ooty Lake, Mukurthi National Park
sources.shortName: 20 Best Places to Visit in Ooty | Tamil Nadu

places.name: Ketti Valley View Point

reviews.text:
Ooty and was absolutely blown away by the scenery. The panoramic view of the Nilgiri Hills, the cool breeze, and the peaceful surroundings made it a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle.

It's an ideal spot for photography, quiet reflection, or just soaking in the beauty of nature. I recommend visiting early in the morning or around sunset for the best light and fewer crowds.

A rs 20 per person entry to see something that is for free down the road. Ok place with not so functional telescopes.
A view of the valley with mountains is a pleasure to see.
Lots of free places to get similar or better views.

The place was very crowded when I went there because of school students who were on tour. The view was "okay" considering it was 10 am in the morning.  It must have been nice only if it were quiet. Instead, everywhere I could see people were taking dance videos for reels or taking "aesthetic" photos. Photos are only meant to remember what we "experienced" that time.

places.address: 9PQG+H24, Nagapattinam - Coimbatore - Gundlupet Hwy, Thalayathimund, Tamil Nadu 643002, India

places.generalDescription: Ooty Hill Station, often referred to as the "Queen of Hill Stations," is a stunning gem nestled in the Nilgiri Hills of Tamil Nadu, India. This expansive hill station offers an array of attractions for everyone‚Äîfrom couples seeking a romantic getaway to families enjoying quality time together. The breathtaking landscapes are adorned with lush tea gardens and vibrant rose gardens, making it a visual delight.

sources.shortName: 90 Places To Visit In Ooty To Enjoy The Queen Of Hill Stations

places.name: Ooty Hill Station

reviews.text: Traveled solo to Ooty and it was exactly what I needed. So peaceful, so calm. The weather was just perfect, 16¬∞C in the middle of July felt like a quiet escape from the city heat. Early morning fog, misty hills, and the silence of nature‚Ä¶ truly refreshing. Would definitely go back again.

Ooty, the ‚ÄúQueen of Hills,‚Äù truly lives up to its name! The cool climate, misty mountains, and endless greenery make it a perfect escape from city life. The tea gardens are breathtaking, and the fresh aroma lingers everywhere. Places like Doddabetta Peak, Botanical Garden, and Ooty Lake are must-visits. The Nilgiri Mountain Train ride is a magical experience through tunnels, valleys, and tea estates.

The town is peaceful, the people are warm, and the homemade chocolates are a must-try! Whether it's for relaxation, family trips, or a romantic getaway, Ooty is a wonderful destination that leaves you refreshed and happy. üå∏üöû

One of the best hill station in India.
Better than most of hill station, this is big hill station with so many places to visit and so many places to hangout with your Better half.
Ooty suites for all types of public,
Honey moon
Vacation
Family holidays
With kids
Best time to visit is Feb to may

places.address: CM6W+32M, Kandal, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India

places.generalDescription: Tea Estate Ooty, located in the village of Glenmorgan, about 25 km from Ooty, is one of the oldest and most charming tea estates in the region. Visitors can immerse themselves in the entire tea-making process, from plucking to packaging, and learn about the various types of tea grown on the estate. The sweet aroma of fresh tea leaves adds to the experience. The estate also features a gift shop where visitors can purchase some of these fascinating varieties.

sources.snippet: Glenmorgan is the name of a village situated around 25 km from Ooty. It is one of the oldest tea estates in the region. As the name suggests, it is a must visit for the tea lovers.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Ooty (Udhagamandalam) (2025)

places.name: Tea Estate Ooty

reviews.text: Beautiful Tea estate. When I went, nobody was there. Generally not crowded. Finding this place is a little difficult. There is no name board, No parking space available. There is no entry fee. Anybody can visit. Car to be parked in the narrow road and some distance to be covered by walk. People living nearby can guide.
I visited this place in summer the sky was so clear and nice..nature will amaze us and i clicked some photos in the costume ‚ù£Ô∏è
Tea Estate, Ooty ‚Äì Here too, they charge an entry fee as someone's private estate has been made into a viewpoint. Overall, it's good. Since we visit rarely, it's worth going at least once.

places.name: High Hill Tea

reviews.text: Great tea shop with a variety of flavored teas at reasonable prices. I appreciated being able to sample one of the flavors before buying it, really helped in making a choice. A nice spot for tea lovers!
Visited  high hills tea for having ginger tea after reading lot of reviews. I found the tea to be average. View from here is very beautiful, adding pictures for view as well that I captured.

This place is a quiet one which is not far from the city but gives so much peaceful and relax atmosphere. For kids, there are few playing items..A place where a family can spend few hours in the chilly climate. There is a entry fee of 20 Rs for adults and 10 rs for kids.. A parking fee of 40 rs for Car and Keep is levied.
There are not much changes from my last visit except the cold weather. It was so chilled and it was so delightful to watch the scenic beauty.

places.generalDescription: The Ooty Toy Train Tourist Park, also known as the Nilgiri Mountain Railway, offers a unique and unforgettable experience for visitors to Ooty. This historical train ride from Mettupalayam to Ooty via Coonoor is a must-do activity when in the area. The train features both first class and second class seating options, with first class offering more comfort and fewer seats.

sources.snippet: A part of Nilgiri Mountain Railway, Ooty Toy Train is an integral part of every Ooty Tour. It runs from Mettupalayam to Ooty via Coonoor. The ride in this historical toy Train is unmatched to any other train ride; passing through lush green landscapes and breathtaking nilgiri mountains, this train runs on a track of 46 km.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to Visit in Ooty

places.name: Ooty Toy Train Tourist Park

reviews.text:
You remember that song? Chal chaiya chaiya?
Yes, it was shot here üëØ
The Ooty toy train is a must-experience attraction in Tamil Nadu, India. *Ride Experience*: The train journey is slow but fun, offering breathtaking views of the countryside from Coonoor to Ooty ¬π. You'll pass through tunnels, forests, and bridges, making it a wonderful way to see the scenic beauty of the Nilgiris.

*Ticketing and Seating*: Tickets can be booked in advance through IRCTC, with prices starting from ‚Çπ140 for a regular ticket and ‚Çπ350 for a first-class ticket ¬≤. First-class tickets offer more comfortable seating, but some reviewers have noted that the seats can be cramped ¬π.

*Tips and Insights*:

- _Book in Advance_: Tickets tend to sell out quickly, so book your tickets well in advance to avoid disappointment.

Ooty Toy Train üöÇ

It's one of a kind lifetime experience one must not miss, because it's in India we under rate it I feel. Extremely beautiful landscapes to see through train window. The whole journey is surreal with breath taking lush greenery. It's feast to eyes!!

Prior booking is advisable for a smooth journey, it was quite crowded when we went, though we had a ticket we had squeeze & sit.

We got the ticket üéüÔ∏è at the last moment, that day we had to leave back to Bangalore, thank god we got them or else we would have missed such a beautiful sight seeing here!

I don't want to give away too much, I would say highly recommended, do it to feel it!!!

My journey from Coonoor to Ooty on the Nilgiri Mountain Railway Toy Train was nothing short of magical, and I can't recommend it enough! I took the 7:45 AM train, which is the perfect time to soak in the beauty of the Nilgiris in the crisp morning light. Booking tickets online through IRCTC was a breeze, and at around ‚Çπ150, it's an absolute steal for such an unforgettable experience. Make sure to snag a window seat if you can, it's a game changer! As the train chugged along, I was mesmerized by the breathtaking views of Ooty's lush green valleys, rolling hills, and charming little villages nestled in the landscape. The cool, refreshing weather added to the charm, making every moment feel like a scene from a postcard. The slow, rhythmic journey through tunnels and over bridges allowed me to fully appreciate the serene beauty of the region. The train itself, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, has a nostalgic charm that enhances the experience. Whether you're a nature lover, a photography enthusiast, or just looking for a unique adventure, this morning ride is a must-do when visiting Ooty. Trust me, you'll leave with memories to cherish!

places.generalDescription: Shooting Point in Ooty offers a picturesque setting with endless green meadows and mist-covered rolling hills, creating a fairy-tale-like ambiance. The location is perfect for recreating iconic movie scenes or capturing stunning photographs. Visitors can enjoy horse rides at affordable rates and are advised to dress warmly due to the cold, heavy winds at the hilltop. With an entry ticket of 30, this beautiful spot provides breathtaking views and ample photo opportunities amidst its lovely hills.

sources.snippet: Ooty Shooting Point Address: Nagapattinam ‚Äì Coimbatore ‚Äì Gundlupet Hwy, Tamil Nadu 643005Distance from Ooty: 7.8 KMContact: N/ARecommended Timings: 7:00 am ‚Äì 6:00 pmEntrance Fee: N/A. Movie buffs will easily identify this lush-green meadow surrounded by thick forests and mesmeric Nilgiris, as it has been seen in many of the Bollywood blockbusters. Locally known as ‚ÄòShooting Medu‚Äô,
sources.shortName: 18 BEST Places to Visit in Ooty for 2 Days | Ooty Nearest Airport

sources.snippet: Have you ever wanted to visit fairy-tale-like settings and recreate iconic scenes from your favourite movies?. Head to Shooting Point in Ooty, where a picturesque view of unending green meadows and rolling hills veiled in thin white fog awaits you.
sources.shortName: Ooty | Udhagamandalam | Hill stations in Tamil Nadu

places.name: SHOOTING POINT

reviews.text: "Visited in May and had a magical experience at Shooting Point! The mountain views are simply breathtaking, with cool breeze, green meadows, and peaceful vibes all around. Early morning or late afternoon is the best time to visit for golden light. A perfect spot to feel on top of the world!"

Shooting Point in Ooty is a breathtaking tourist spot known for its lush green meadows, rolling hills, and panoramic views of the Nilgiri Mountains. A favorite among filmmakers, this scenic location offers a peaceful escape from city life. The cool climate, fresh air, and stunning landscapes make it an ideal spot for photography, picnics, and horse riding. However, the road leading to the point can be a bit rough, and it may get crowded during peak seasons. Despite this, the serene beauty and cinematic charm make it a must-visit destination for nature lovers and photography enthusiasts.
A serene escape, the grass hilltop offers stunning panoramic views. The grass is well-kept, and it's a pleasant place for a short rest or a quiet walk.

places.generalDescription: Thread Garden in Ooty, also known as Udagamandalam, is a must-visit attraction that showcases an extraordinary collection of artificial flowers and plants meticulously crafted from thread, canvas, and wire. This unique garden features around 150 species of lifelike flora created using a technique called four-dimensional hand-wound embroidery. The skilled artists have utilized approximately 6 crore meters of embroidery thread to bring this captivating display to life.

sources.snippet: Located opposite the Ooty Lake and 1.5 km away from the railway station, Ooty Thread Garden is another unique tourist attraction in the town. Brainchild of a former professor Mr. Antony Joseph, it is a garden made of artificial flowers. All the flowers and the plants are made out of thread, using the four dimensional hand-wound embroidery.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to Visit in Ooty

sources.snippet: The thread garden of Ooty is filled with some of the most beautiful collection of artificial flowers and plants that have all been made by skilled artists using only thread. Antony Joseph is the mastermind behind concept and has worked constantly for 12 years to bring his idea to conceptualization.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Ooty

sources.snippet: The thread garden at Ooty is a popular tourist spot that exhibits some of the most magnificent and exquisite collection of artificial flowers and plants, all made by the expert hands of the skilful artists by using JUST thread.
sources.shortName: 43 Best Places to visit in Ooty | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Thread Garden

reviews.text:
This beautiful artificial flower garden is made completely with thread by 50 women who worked hard for 12 long years to make it.

It's right opposite to the boat house, very unique one of it's kind in the world. Kudos to these women. It's a small place but a very cute place & great effort.

The colour combination the flowers it's very close to reality. Entry fee is very nominal just Rs.30/- Please go & support & appreciate their hard work & dedication.

They do have a small shop to buy them too! They are very adorable to gift! üéÅ

This thread garden is unique in itself. This is a garden completely made up of threads used in cloths. Some people may not like it as it is small and hardly take 10 min to explore. You can busy some of them at counter. It also made a record for being unique and made up of threads

Thread garden is an artificial garden with flowers made of collar canvas and thread.

Very small place. Opposite to Ooty boat house / lake.

Well made, it has taken around 12 years to make this, I am given to understand.

Entrance fee is Rs.30 per adult.

places.address: CM4Q+Q86, N Lake Rd, opp. Boat House, Kathadimattam, Ooty, Tamil Nadu 643001, India
